isis.stitle: POWER STEERING PUMP: EATON MODEL BB135 R, L - ADJUSTMENTS - BELT ADJUSTMENT

svcproc.title: BELT ADJUSTMENT
svcproc.para: When adjusting a power steering pump belt, never pry against the pump reservoir or pull against the filler neck. To increase belt tension, move the pump outward by prying against the bracket pry lugs or against the pump housing casting extension directly behind the pump drive pulley.

step1.para: When power steering pump is driven by a single belt:

step2.para: Loosen the pump attaching bolts and adjust the belt to correct tension by moving the pump outward, away from the engine.
Snug all pump mounting bolts and remove pry bar.
Tighten all pump mounting bolts to specifications in the TORQUE CHART.

step1.para: When the power steering pump is driven by two belts in a matched set: Follow same checking and adjusting procedure as in step 1 above, but if it is necessary to replace one belt, both must be replaced by a new matched set to equalize belt tension in both belts. Check tension in both belts.
When the power steering pump pulley is driven by one primary belt and is used as an idler for a second belt driving some other accessory:

step2.para: Follow same checking and adjusting procedure for the primary power steering pump drive belt as for above.
Recheck and adjust as necessary the pump belt tension after adjusting tension on belt driving the other accessory.
